title: No spoiler card
custom_preconds: Given: Users sets a delay
custom_expected:
1. The arrow does not spoil what happened during the current at bat until the delayed resolution comes in.
2. If a delay has been set by the player, then render a No Spoiler Card on top of the peeking card in the stack. 
3. The player can still swipe to the cards that are under the No Spoiler Card.
4. If the delay is removed, then the No Spoiler Card is also removed.
5. The no spoiler card should only show if the card is greater than the activeIndex (from the view model) in DeckViewController.

title: A pitch is thrown
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is viewing the pitchcast strikezone AND a pitch is thrown
custom_expected:
THEN A dot is displayed in the vicinity of the strikezone grid in the position that the pitch crossed the plane
1. Dots will be color coded (see later steps)

Dot behavior:
1. each pitch is numbered inside of the dot
2. active pitch is bright and has a halo
3. previous pitch is bright but does not have a halo
4. the color of each pitch previous to that will get less bright
5. pitches should remain on the at-bat player's card and not transfer when switching cards

title: Arrow button
custom_preconds: User is playing the game

Pressing the blue arrow floating icon should quick-scroll the user to the current At-bat or Batter Up card.

custom_steps_separated.content: If the next card is OPEN,
custom_steps_separated.expected: keep the card in the deck.

custom_steps_separated.expected: remove the card from the deck.

custom_steps_separated.content:
All Edge cases are deemed acceptable by product and will not be addressed :

Edge Case : What if a card is stuck in the open state, this means the card behind it will be stuck as well. (Services is fixing this on the half-inning switch-over).

Edge Case : Large delay means this card is going away quite quickly or won’t be retained at all.

Edge Case : If we implement this on an inning change, the next card will be withdrawn and your card will go away immediately.

Edge Case: If you expand this card while it’s in the deck, and then close it after it's removed, the close animation will have an odd snap at the end transitioning to a new card.
